description: Demolition of existing building (Class B1) and erection of a part 4/part 3 storey new building comprising of a gymnasium (Class D2) with ancillary cafï¿½.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The details of the fenestration, facing materials and glazing treatment (including obscured glazing, sunshades and louvered panels) to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, and they shall thereafter be permanently maintained and retained as such.  

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not commence until full details of a scheme for the heating, cooling and ventilation of the gymnasium accommodation, including the extraction of fumes from the premises to an adequate outlet level, and including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant, have been submitted to and approved by the Council, and approved details have been fully implemented.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - No persons/customers shall be on the premises in connection with the use between 21.30 and 06.30 on Mondays to Fridays, and 20.30 and 08.00 on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays and no sound emanating from these premises from the use shall be audible within any adjoining premises at all times.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - Before the use commences, sound insulation shall be provided for the building in accordance with a scheme that has been first approved by the local planning authority. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - No music or other amplified sound shall be played on the premises in such a way as to be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery (measured in LAeq) shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels (LA90), expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - No development shall take place until:
a) The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination for approval by the Council; and
b) The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council.  All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial use of the site in accordance with policy EN10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - Except for emergency access, all access to the premises including by members /customers and staff, or for the purposes of loading and unloading of goods or  collection of waste shall take place through the main entrance of the premises off Kilburn High Road and no access to the premises including by members /customers and staff, or for the purposes of loading and unloading of goods and collection of waste shall be allowed through the single ground floor door in the middle of the southern side elevation facing the driveway at no. 246 Kilburn High Road (which shall be used solely for the purposes of emergency access/egress and for no other purpose.)

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard the amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN1, EN5, EN6, EN19 and TR23 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.  
Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing nos. 187.11 RevC and 187.12 RevC hereby approved, the bicycle storage room shall not be incorporated at the rear of the ground floor plan. Prior to the commencement of works, revised drawings shall be submitted to and approved by the Council, omitting the bicycle storage at the rear ground floor and its rear door on the southern side elevation, and relocating the bicycle storage to within the front of the building for at least 5 bicycles, having access only via the main front entrance off Kilburn High Road. The use shall not commence until the bicycle storage facility has been provided in strict accordance with the approved details, and it shall be permanently retained and maintained as such thereafter. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of adjoining premises and the appearance of the new premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the drawings hereby approved, all glazing on the proposed south western front elevation and southern side elevation of the rear part of the new building shall either be obscured glazing or clear glazing obscured by louvered panels, in accordance with details that shall first have been submitted to and approved by the Council. The use shall not commence until the glazing or louvered panels have been provided in strict accordance with the approved details, and the fenestration shall be permanently retained and maintained as such thereafter. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of adjoining premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Class D2 of the Schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order, 1987, or any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order, the premises shall not be used as a cinema, concert hall, bingo hall, dance hall or  casino.

Reason: To ensure that the future occupation of the building does not adversely affect the adjoining premises/immediate area by reason of noise, traffic congestion and excessive on-street parking pressure in accordance with policies RE2, EN5 and EN6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
